intro: Scleranthus haepei, commonly known as the common scarlet pimpernel, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and Africa. It is a member of the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its small, bright yellow flowers that appear in clusters. The plant has hairy, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Scleranthus haepei is known for its rapid growth and ability to reseed itself, making it a common weed in many regions.
